task.title: Enabling cluster membership of servers in a high availability pair
task.shortdesc: You can enable cluster membership of servers in a high availability (HA) pair by using the .

context.p: System administrators can enable cluster membership of servers in an HA pair by using the , or by using . For more information about using to enable cluster membership of servers in an HA pair, see .
In this scenario, Server A is the primary node and Server B is the standby node in the HA pair.

step.cmd: Configure cluster membership values that relate to addresses and ports on Server B. Do not enable cluster membership on Server B.

substep.cmd: Ensure that you are managing Server B. In the Cluster menu, select Join/Leave
Click Edit in the Configuration panel.

ol.li: Type the control address of Server B into the Control Address field.

Ensure that the other cluster membership configuration parameters that are necessary for Server A and B to identify and connect to the other members of the cluster are set, for example, if Server A is using external addresses or ports. For more information about the parameters that you can set to configure cluster membership on a server, see .

note.p: You cannot update the values for the following fields on a Standby server:

step.cmd: Configure and enable cluster membership on Server A.

substep.cmd: Ensure that you are managing Server A. In the Cluster menu, select Join/Leave
Click Edit in the Configuration panel.

ol.li: Type the name of the cluster that Server A is to join in the Cluster Name field. This must be the same name as the name of the cluster that you specified for Server B to join.
Type the control address of Server A into the Control Address field.

Ensure that the other cluster membership configuration parameters that are necessary for Server A and B to identify and connect to the other members of the cluster are set, for example, if Server B is using external addresses or ports. For more information about the parameters that you can set to configure cluster membership on a server, see .

substep.cmd: Ensure that you are managing Server B. In the Server menu, select Server Control
Click Restart the server, and then click Restart
Switch to managing Server A. In the Server menu, select Server Control
Click Restart the server, and then click Restart

step.cmd: After your servers have restarted, verify the status of your servers.
step.info: If either server is in maintenance mode, repeat step .

substep.cmd: On Server A, check the Status drop-down list and verify that the status displays the values High Availability: Primary node and Cluster: Active
In the Cluster menu, click Status
In the Cluster Status Data pane, ensure that the other members of the cluster are visible in the table.
On Server B, check the Status drop-down list and verify that the status displays the values High Availability: Standby node and Cluster: Standby
